verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. Hear <WH8085> <WH8798> my voice <WH6963>, O 'Elohim <WH430>, in my prayer <WH7879>: preserve <WH5341> <WH8799> my life <WH2416> from fear <WH6343> of the enemy <WH341> <WH8802>.
Hide <WH5641> <WH8686> me from the secret counsel <WH5475> of the wicked <WH7489> <WH8688>; from the insurrection <WH7285> of the workers <WH6466> <WH8802> of iniquity <WH205>:
Who whet <WH8150> <WH8804> their tongue <WH3956> like a sword <WH2719>, and bend <WH1869> <WH8804> their bows to shoot their arrows <WH2671>, even bitter <WH4751> words <WH1697>:
That they may shoot <WH3384> <WH8800> in secret <WH4565> at the perfect <WH8535>: suddenly <WH6597> do they shoot <WH3384> <WH8686> at him, and fear <WH3372> <WH8799> not.

They encourage <WH2388> <WH8762> themselves in an evil <WH7451> matter <WH1697>: they commune <WH5608> <WH8762> of laying <WH2934> snares <WH4170> privily <WH2934> <WH8800>; they say <WH559> <WH8804>, Who shall see <WH7200> <WH8799> them?

They search out <WH2664> <WH8799> iniquities <WH5766>; they accomplish <WH8552> <WH8804> a diligent <WH2664> <WH8794> search <WH2665>: both the inward <WH7130> thought of every one <WH376> of them, and the heart <WH3820>, is deep <WH6013>.
But 'Elohim <WH430> shall shoot <WH3384> <WH8686> at them with an arrow <WH2671>; suddenly <WH6597> shall they be wounded <WH4347>.
So they shall make their own tongue <WH3956> to fall <WH3782> <WH8686> upon themselves: all that see <WH7200> <WH8802> them shall flee away <WH5074> <WH8709>.
And all men <WH120> shall fear <WH3372> <WH8799>, and shall declare <WH5046> <WH8686> the work <WH6467> of 'Elohim <WH430>; for they shall wisely consider <WH7919> <WH8689> of his doing <WH4639>.
The righteous <WH6662> shall be glad <WH8055> <WH8799> in the YY <WH3068>, and shall trust <WH2620> <WH8804> in him; and all the upright <WH3477> in heart <WH3820> shall glory <WH1984> <WH8691>.
